Brief purpose: Read a line from input with editing/history support; returns allocated string (caller must free) or NULL on EOF.
Clear the readline history list and free memory.
Inform readline that the cursor is now on a new line (used in signal handlers).
Replace the current readline buffer with the given text (optionally clear undo).
Force readline to redraw the current input line on the terminal.
Add a line to the readline history list.
Formatted output to stdout; returns number of characters printed or negative on error.
Allocate memory from the heap; returns pointer or NULL on failure.
Free memory previously allocated by malloc/calloc/realloc.
Low-level write to a file descriptor; returns bytes written or -1 on error.
Typical header / return: <unistd.h> — ssize_t write(int fd, const void *buf, size_t count)

Brief purpose: Check real-user permissions for a pathname (existence/read/write/exec).
Open a file and return a file descriptor (or -1 on error).
Typical header / return: <fcntl.h> — int open(const char *pathname, int flags, mode_t mode)

Brief purpose: Low-level read from a file descriptor; returns bytes read (0 on EOF) or -1 on error.
Typical header / return: <unistd.h> — ssize_t read(int fd, void *buf, size_t count)

Brief purpose: Close a file descriptor; returns 0 on success or -1 on error.
Create a child process; returns 0 in child, child's pid in parent, or -1 on error.
Wait for any child process to change state; returns pid or -1 on error.
Wait for a specific child (by pid) with options; returns pid or -1 on error.
Typical header / return: <sys/wait.h> — pid_t waitpid(pid_t pid, int *status, int options)

Brief purpose: Wait for any child and optionally get rusage (BSD/SysV variant); returns pid or -1.
Typical header / return: <sys/wait.h> (BSD) — pid_t wait3(int *status, int options, struct rusage *rusage)

Brief purpose: Wait for a specific child and get rusage; returns pid or -1.
Typical header / return: <sys/wait.h> (BSD) — pid_t wait4(pid_t pid, int *status, int options, struct rusage *rusage)

Brief purpose: Simplified signal handler setup (historic); returns previous handler or SIG_ERR.
Robust signal handler control and flags; returns 0 on success, -1 on error.
Typical header / return: <signal.h> — int sigaction(int signum, const struct sigaction *act, struct sigaction *oldact)

Brief purpose: Initialize a signal set to be empty; returns 0 on success.
Add a signal to a signal set; returns 0 on success.
Send a signal to a process (or process group); returns 0 on success or -1 on error.
Terminate the calling process with the given exit status (does not return).
Get current working directory into buffer (or return malloc'd string if buf NULL).
Change the current working directory; returns 0 on success or -1 on error.
Get file status (follows symlinks); fills struct stat; returns 0 or -1.
Like stat but does not follow symlinks (returns info about the link).
Get file status for an open file descriptor; returns 0 or -1.
Remove (delete) a name from the filesystem (unlink a file); returns 0 or -1.
Execute a program, replacing the current process image; returns only on error (-1).
Typical header / return: <unistd.h> — int execve(const char *pathname, char *const argv[], char *const envp[])

Brief purpose: Duplicate a file descriptor, returning a new fd or -1 on error.
Duplicate oldfd onto newfd (closing newfd first if needed); returns newfd or -1.
Create a unidirectional pipe (pair of fds: pipefd[0]=read, pipefd[1]=write); returns 0 or -1.
Open a directory stream for reading entries; returns DIR* or NULL on error.
Read the next directory entry from DIR*; returns pointer or NULL at end/error.
Close a directory stream; returns 0 on success or -1 on error.
Return a read-only string describing the error number provided.
Print the current errno message prefixed by given string to stderr.
Test whether a file descriptor refers to a terminal; returns 1 (yes) or 0 (no).
Return pathname of terminal associated with fd (or NULL on error).
Return the utmp slot number of the calling process's tty (system-dependent).
Device-specific I/O control operations on file descriptors; return depends on request.
Typical header / return: <sys/ioctl.h> — int ioctl(int fd, unsigned long request, ...)

Brief purpose: Get value of an environment variable; returns pointer to value or NULL.
Set terminal attributes for fd (actions: TCSANOW, etc.); returns 0 or -1.
Typical header / return: <termios.h> — int tcsetattr(int fd, int optional_actions, const struct termios *termios_p)

Brief purpose: Get terminal attributes for fd; returns 0 or -1.
Initialize termcap entry for a terminal name; returns >0 on success, 0/‑1 on fail.
Get a boolean termcap capability by two-letter id; returns 1 if present else 0 or -1.
Get numeric termcap capability; returns value or -1 if absent.
Get string termcap capability; returns pointer to string or NULL.
Generate cursor-movement string from a termcap capability with parameters.
Typical header / return: <term.h> — char *tgoto(const char *cap, int col, int row)

Brief purpose: Output a termcap string with padding using a provided putc-like function.
Typical header / return: <term.h> — int tputs(const char *str, int affcnt, int (*putc)(int))
